intro: Crepidomanes africanum, commonly known as the African wall-ivy, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or blue in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocks or walls. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and adaptable species within its native habitat.
